metadata.title: CVE-2018-13982 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Smarty_Security::isTrustedResourceDir() in Smarty before 3.1.33 is prone toa path traversal vulnerability due to insufficient template codesanitization. This allows attackers controlling the executed template codeto bypass the trusted directory security restriction and read arbitraryfiles.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13982` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

smarty3 - 3.1.33+20180830.1.3a78a21f+selfpack1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: smarty3 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.33+20180830.1.3a78a21f+selfpack1-1').
